title: Establishment of the National Energy Dominance Council
summary: This executive order establishes the National Energy Dominance Council, aimed at coordinating and promoting policies related to the United States' energy resources. The council is intended to enhance the development and utilization of natural resources, support technological innovation in energy, and advance the nation’s economic prosperity and national security. The order underscores the importance of energy independence and the role of the United States as a leader in energy technologies.

title: Nominations of Individuals for Assistant Secretary Positions and General Counsel to be Submitted to the Senate
summary: This document outlines the nominations submitted to the Senate for the following positions: Gary Andres from Virginia for the role of Assistant Secretary of Health and Human Services; Daniel Aronowitz from Virginia for the position of Assistant Secretary of Labor; James Baehr from Louisiana for the office of General Counsel at the Department of Veterans Affairs; and Kirsten Baesler from North Dakota for the position of Assistant Secretary for Elementary and Secondary Education. These nominations are part of the executive branch's efforts to fill key government positions.

title: Proclamation on the Investigation of Aluminum Imports and National Security
summary: This proclamation addresses the findings from a report submitted by the Secretary of Commerce regarding the impact of aluminum imports on the national security of the United States. The report was conducted under section 232 of the Trade Expansion Act of 1962 and includes recommendations and actions for managing aluminum imports to ensure they do not compromise national security interests.

title: Announcement of Appointments to the President's Intelligence Advisory Board
summary: This announcement details the selection of individuals to serve on the President’s Intelligence Advisory Board (PIAB). The board is intended to provide guidance on national security challenges and to ensure that the Intelligence Community aligns with the President's policy objectives. The appointed advisors bring diverse experiences and expertise relevant to national security and intelligence matters.

title: Proclamation Regarding Adjustments to Steel Imports from Argentina and Australia
summary: This proclamation addresses adjustments to the importation of steel into the United States as a result of discussions held with the Argentine Republic and the Commonwealth of Australia. It references a prior proclamation made on May 31, 2018, concerning similar adjustments and outlines the changes agreed upon as a result of these diplomatic engagements.

title: Suspension of Foreign Corrupt Practices Act Enforcement for Economic and National Security Review
summary: This executive order addresses the enforcement of the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (FCPA), originally enacted in 1977. The order outlines a temporary pause in enforcing certain provisions of the FCPA to allow for a review of its implications on American economic interests and national security. It aims to consider how the enforcement of these regulations may impact the overall economic environment and security landscape of the United States.
